vocabinfos.relatedNos: [{'strongNumber': 'G2502', 'matchingForm': 'Ἰωσίας', 'stepTransliteration': 'iōsias', 'gloss': 'Josiah', '_searchResultRange': 'Matt.1.10-11@1Kgs.13.2-Matt.1.11', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '約西亞', '_es_Gloss': 'Josías', '_zh_Gloss': '约西亚'}, {'strongNumber': 'H2977H', 'matchingForm': 'יֹאשִׁיָּ֫הוּ', 'stepTransliteration': 'yo.shiy.ya.hu', 'gloss': 'Josiah', '_searchResultRange': 'Zech.6.10@Zech.6.10-14', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '約西亞', '_es_Gloss': 'Josías', '_zh_Gloss': '约西亚'}]
vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A king of the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.13.2;
son of: Amon (H0526H) and Jedidah (H3040); married to Hamutal (H2537) and Zebidah (H2080);
father of: Jehoahaz (H3059H), Jehoiakim (H3079), Zedekiah (H6667H) and Shallum (H7967J)
Also named: Iōsias<\i> (Ἰωσίας "Josiah" G2502)
§ Josiah = "whom Jehovah heals"
1) son of Amon by Jedidah who succeeded his father to the throne of Judah and reigned for 31 years; his reign is noteworthy for the great revivals back to the worship of Jehovah which he led
2) a returned exile and son of Zephaniah at whose house took place the solemn and symbolical crowning of Joshua the high priest in the time of Zechariah the prophet
vocabinfos._es_Definition: hijo de Sofonías; en tiempos del profeta Zacarías \hijo de Amón; rey de Judá (640/39-609)
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
約西亞 这个陽性專有名詞在相同字的意思是 "耶和華所醫治的"
1) 亞們之子, 耶底大所生. 繼承乃父猶大王位, 統治了三十一年;
他在位時, 值得一記的是他曾率領人民重新敬拜耶和華所帶
動的屬靈大復興.
2) 被擄歸回的西番雅之子, 在先知撒迦利亞時期, 為大祭司約書亞
象徵性加冕的莊嚴儀式, 就是在希番雅家中舉行的. (亞 6:10)
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
约西亚 这个阳性专有名词在相同字的意思是 "耶和华所医治的"
1) 亚们之子, 耶底大所生. 继承乃父犹大王位, 统治了三十一年;
他在位时, 值得一记的是他曾率领人民重新敬拜耶和华所带
动的属灵大复兴.
2) 被掳归回的西番雅之子, 在先知撒迦利亚时期, 为大祭司约书亚
象征性加冕的庄严仪式, 就是在希番雅家中举行的. (亚 6:10)

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Zec.6.10;
son of: Zephaniah (H6846I); also called Hen at Zec.6.14;
Also named: chen (חֵן "Hen" H2581)
§ Josiah = "whom Jehovah heals"
1) son of Amon by Jedidah who succeeded his father to the throne of Judah and reigned for 31 years; his reign is noteworthy for the great revivals back to the worship of Jehovah which he led
2) a returned exile and son of Zephaniah at whose house took place the solemn and symbolical crowning of Joshua the high priest in the time of Zechariah the prophet
